column22: The other vote was: Scattered Write-Ins (Other) 7,837
Neither major-party candidate won an absolute majority in this November election; therefore a run-off election was held February 26, 1991.
The other vote was: Scattered Write-Ins (Other) 16,044
In January 1989, Lt. Governor Robert J. Miller (D) became Governor on the resignation of Gov. Richard H. Bryan (D) following his election November 1988 to the U.S. Senate.
The other vote was: Scattered Write-Ins (Other) 206,247

Incumbent Governor Edwin W. Edwards withdrew after running second in the primary and no run-off general election was required.; The other vote was: Scattered Write-Ins (Other) 162,992; Tauzin, W. J. (Democrat) 154,079

There was no Democratic candidate for Governor on the ballot, Mark Fairchild being the "paired" Democrat for Lt. Governor.  The Democratic vote was cast for the ticket of "no name" and Fairchild.; The other vote was: Scattered Write-Ins (Other) 22,673
In the absence of a majority for any candidate, the State Legislature elected Madeleine M. Kunin to a  two-year term.
In Louisiana, any candidate who receives a majority is elected.  Since Edwards received a majority of the vote, no run-off general election was required.
